availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hercules Walker (Jefferson county, Kentucky, guerrilla and farmer)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, farmer and guerrilla. Kentucky native. Son of Gideon Walker and Eliza Walker. Farmer in Jefferson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Confederate guerrilla. Killed by Edwin Terrell, commander of the Independent Kentucky Scouts (U.S.A.), in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, District 2, p. 233A.
Hulbert, Matthew Christopher, The Ghosts of Guerrilla Memory: How Civil War Bushwhackers Became Gunslingers in the American West (Athens: The University of Georgia Press, 2016), 268, n. 15.
